lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio’s plan, which includes three new routes by the end of June 2017, would be one of the biggest bets any city in the world has made on boats as vehicles for mass transit.

headline.print_headline: New York’s Ferry Push: Rides to 5 Boroughs, at a Subway Price
headline.main: De Blasio’s $325 Million Ferry Push: Rides to 5 Boroughs, at Subway Price

snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio’s plan, which includes three new routes by the end of June 2017, would be one of the biggest bets any city in the world has made on boats as vehicles for mass transit.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio has announced expensive expansion of commuter ferryboat service; expansion, which would result in fleet of city-owned vessels connecting all five boroughs, could cost over $325 million, and de Blasio predicts would serve 4.5 million passengers annually.
